title: Sons of Anarchy's Charlie Hunnam joins Chris Hemsworth and Elsa Pataky at the UFC in Melbourne
text:
He played the tough bikie outlaw, Jax Teller, in Sons of Anarchy, who was never one to shy away from a fight.

And on Sunday, British actor Charlie Hunnam enjoyed a day at the UFC 243 event in Melbourne, Australia.

The 39-year-old cut a casual figure on the day as he sat by the ring and eagerly watched on, joining the likes of Chris Hemsworth and Elsa Pataky in the crowd.

Star power! Sons of Anarchy's Charlie Hunnam cut a casual figure on Sunday as he joined the likes of Chris Hemsworth and Elsa Pataky at the UFC in Melbourne

Charlie wore dark jeans on the day with a colourful purple shirt and a black striped jacket.

He accessorised with a silver watch, a dark beanie and sported a scruffy beard.

The LA-based star joined the likes of Chris and Elsa, and Home and Away star Sam Frost at the event.

Low-key: Charlie wore dark jeans on the day with a colourful purple shirt and a black striped jacket

Fancy seeing you here! The LA-based star joined the likes of Chris and Elsa, and Home and Away star Sam Frost at the event

Charlie has been busy of late with work, having recently filmed the upcoming flick The Gentlemen, alongside Matthew McConaughey.

He's just been cast in the Apple series Shantaram, based on Gregory David Robert's book, where a man goes on the run to India after escaping an Australian prison.

He's best known for portraying bikie outlaw, Jax Teller, in Sons of Anarchy, which ran from 2008-2014.

Familiar face: He's best known for portraying bikie outlaw, Jax Teller, in Sons of Anarchy, which ran from 2008-2014

He told Glamour in May 2017 that it was hard to say goodbye to Jax after playing him for so long.

'It was actually quite emotional for me, living and loving that guy for eight years, to have to finally put him to bed,' Charlie said.

'I found myself going back to set a lot. I knew the security guards and for a couple of days said, 'oh, I forgot something,' so they'd let me onto the set, and I'd just walk around at night because I wanted to be in that environment and go through a personal process of saying goodbye.'
